snippet: Thomas Voeckler won the 16th stage of the Tour de France over four huge climbs in the Pyrenees, while the defending champion, Cadel Evans, dropped out of title contention Wednesday.
abstract: Thomas Voeckler wins the 16th stage of the Tour de France over four huge climbs in the Pyrenees, while the defending champion Cadel Evans drops out of title contention; Bradley Wiggins retains overall lead.
lead_paragraph: Thomas Voeckler won the 16th stage of the Tour de France over four huge climbs in the Pyrenees, while the defending champion, Cadel Evans, dropped out of title contention Wednesday.

headline.main: Nearly Through Mountains, Wiggins Protects Lead as Evans Fades From View
headline.print_headline: Nearly Through Mountains, Wiggins Protects Lead as Evans Fades From View
